title: HTML Paragraphs
gp1: A paragraph always starts on a new line, and is usually a block of text.
gp2:
The HTML

element defines a paragraph.
gp3: A paragraph always starts on a new line, and browsers automatically add some white space (a margin) before and after a paragraph.
gp4: You cannot be sure how HTML will be displayed.
gp5: Large or small screens, and resized windows will create different results.
gp6: With HTML, you cannot change the display by adding extra spaces or extra lines in your HTML code.
gp7: The browser will automatically remove any extra spaces and lines when the page is displayed:
wp1: The <hr> tag defines a thematic break in an HTML page, and is most often displayed as a horizontal rule.
wp2: The <hr> element is used to separate content (or define a change) in an HTML page:
wp3: The <hr> tag is an empty tag, which means that it has no end tag.
wp4:
Use
if you want a line break (a new line) without starting a new paragraph:
wp5:
The
tag is an empty tag, which means that it has no end tag.
wp6: The text inside a <pre> element is displayed in a fixed-width font (usually Courier), and it preserves both spaces and line breaks:
